awd_titl_txt: Student Participation in 2022 Society of Engineering Science Annual Technical Meeting; College Station, Texas; 16-19 October 2022
awd_abstract_narration:
This award provides travel support for 75 undergraduate and graduate students to attend the 2022 Society of Engineering Science (SES) Annual Technical Meeting to be held from October 16 to 19 on the Texas A&M University Campus in College Station, Texas. The selected students will attend the conference and present a poster or presentation. Students will benefit from the technical experience and professional networking in both formal and informal settings. Consideration in the selection process will be given to the inclusion of members of underrepresented groups, diversity of institutions that the students represent, and diversity of programs within engineering. This opportunity will have societal and economic impact of the field of mechanics of materials, and in developing the next generation of researchers and engineers from diverse backgrounds. 

The SES Annual Technical Meetings are a leading forum for bringing together diverse, interdisciplinary groups of researchers to discuss advances in highly focused symposia. In 2022, the conference will have approximately eighty symposia within multiple technical thematic areas that include solids and structures, soft and flexible, biomechanics and mechanobiology, data science and machine learning, fluid and granular, manufacturing and infrastructure, multifunctional and multifield, and robotics and controls. The opportunity to attend and present will broaden the participating students’ technical understanding, stimulate the development of new ideas and research topics, and provide numerous professional development and networking opportunities.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

por.por_cntn:
The 2022 Society of Engineering Science (SES) Annual Technical Meeting, which took place on the Texas A&M University Campus in College Station, TX from October 16-19, 2022, served as a dynamic interdisciplinary forum for the exchange of ideas and information across various disciplines. These disciplines included engineering, physical and life sciences, and mathematics, all with a central focus on mechanics of materials. The primary objective of this conference was to promote the development of these diverse fields while strengthening the interfaces that connect them. By facilitating connections among leading researchers from around the world within a diverse community, this SES conference fostered interdisciplinary discoveries and innovations that are fundamental to advancing engineering sciences and benefiting society.

The specific objectives of this project were threefold: Firstly, to provide financial support for selected science and engineering students based in the US, enabling their attendance and active participation in the 2022 SES Annual Technical Meeting. Secondly, the project aimed to encourage and facilitate students’ involvement in academic discourse by either presenting a poster or delivering an oral presentation at the conference. Lastly, this project sought to promote diversity and inclusivity within the field of mechanics of materials. By achieving these objectives, the project empowered students to immerse themselves in a diverse, interdisciplinary environment and connect with seasoned researchers in various subfields within mechanics of materials. Through these experiences, students gained exposure to cutting-edge research in engineering science, fostered their technical understanding, and encouraged the development of new ideas and research topics. Additionally, the project aimed to provide numerous opportunities for professional development and networking, ensuring that participating students could leverage this unique platform for their academic and career growth.

The financial support provided by this project fully or partially supported the registration fees for over 100 students and accommodations for more than 50 students enrolled in science and engineering programs at universities across the US. As a whole, the conference featured more than 400 posters or oral presentations by students. These outcomes demonstrate the project’s successful achievement of its objectives, including providing vital financial support to US-based science and engineering students, enabling their full participation in the 2022 SES Annual Technical Meeting, encouraging active student involvement in academic discourse, and promoting diversity and inclusivity within the mechanics of materials field.

Intellectual Merits: The 2022 SES Annual Technical Meeting promoted the development of and strengthened interfaces between various disciplines in engineering, sciences, mathematics, and related fields, with a central focus on mechanics of materials. The SES Annual Technical Meetings are recognized as a leading forum for bringing together diverse, interdisciplinary groups of researchers to discuss advances in highly focused symposia. In 2022, the conference featured multiple plenary lectures, keynote/contributed/invited technical talks, and poster sessions across approximately eighty symposia planned within multiple technical thematic areas that included Biomechanics & Mechanobiology, Data Science & Machine Learning, Manufacturing & Infrastructure, Multifunctional & Multifield, Soft & Flexible, and Solids & Structures. Lectures, talks, and posters in these areas showcased the latest cutting-edge topics in mechanics-related multidisciplinary research. The support provided by this project allowed student participants to attend all these technical events. As such, this project not only enabled education and training but also exposed students to new research concepts.

Broader Impacts: The broader impacts of this project lay in the societal and economic impact of the field of mechanics of materials as a whole and in the development of the next generation of researchers and engineers from diverse backgrounds. The project's impact extended beyond science and technology, benefiting society in various ways. Firstly, the exchange of knowledge and ideas among researchers at the conference held the potential to generate practical solutions to real-world challenges, addressing issues related to materials, engineering, and related fields. Secondly, the project's emphasis on diversity and inclusivity fostered a more inclusive scientific community, equipping a diverse workforce to tackle complex societal challenges and innovate solutions from a wide range of perspectives. Furthermore, by supporting the professional development of young researchers, the project contributed to the growth of a highly skilled and knowledgeable workforce.


Last Modified: 01/02/2024
Modified by: Ankit Srivastava
